transcript:
Physician: Good afternoon, I'm Dr. Smith. What's your child's name?

Parent: Hi, I'm Sarah, and my child's name is Lily.

Physician: Nice to meet you, Sarah. How old is Lily?

Parent: She's 2 years old.

Physician: Can you tell me a little about Lily's health history?

Parent: Well, she was born premature at 34 weeks and spent some time in the NICU. She's had a lot of health issues since then, and we're really worried about her.

Physician: I understand. Can you tell me about any physical traits you've noticed in Lily?

Parent: Sure. She has fair hair, a wide mouth, and her tongue sticks out a bit. Her eyes also tend to wander a bit. She's also very clumsy and has a broad-based gait.

Physician: Okay, thank you for sharing that. Have you noticed any tremors or shaking in her limbs?

Parent: Yes, she does have some limb tremors. It's really noticeable when she's trying to pick something up.

Physician: And how is her speech development coming along?

Parent: Lily hasn't spoken any words yet, and we're really worried about that. She also drools a lot and has these bursts of laughter that don't seem to match the situation.

Physician: I see. Has Lily been experiencing any digestive issues?

Parent: Yes, she's been having some trouble with constipation. We've been trying to manage it with diet changes, but it doesn't seem to be helping much.

Physician: Thank you for letting me know. Has Lily been reaching her developmental milestones on time?

Parent: No, she's been experiencing a lot of delays. She's severely intellectually disabled and has global developmental delay.

Physician: I'm sorry to hear that. Has Lily been experiencing any issues with her vision?

Parent: Yes, she has strabismus and exotropia, so her eyes don't always work together. It's been really hard for her to focus on things.

Physician: Thank you for telling me that. Has Lily been experiencing any other issues that you're aware of?

Parent: Yes, she's been struggling with obesity and hypotonia. We're also really worried about her because she has cerebral cortical atrophy.

Physician: Okay, thank you for letting me know. Based on what you've shared, I'm going to recommend some additional testing to get a better understanding of what's going on with Lily. We'll work together to come up with a treatment plan that's best for her.
